dvfisk 0.3.3
  • Reference

Get aggregated data from the Nors API

Source: R/NorsAggregerad.R
nors_aggregerad_rapport.Rd

This function returns electrofishing data from the Nors API. You can filter the data by county (Lan), main drainage area (HaroNr) or lake (Sjo). The function does not check if the parameters are valid and it is possible to give combinations that does not make sense, e.g. a haroNr and Lan that does not intersect. It is also possible send requests that return a lot of data, so be careful.

Usage

nors_aggregerad_rapport(Lan = NULL, HaroNr = NULL, Sjo = NULL)

Arguments

Lan

character string with the name of a county (län) in Sweden

HaroNr

integer with the main drainage area (huvudavrinningsområde) number

Sjo

character string with the name a lake (sjö) in Sweden

Value

A data frame with the electrofishing data. There are 44 columns in the data frame consult Nors-documentation.

See also

Description of https://www.slu.se/en/departments/aquatic-resources1/databases/national-register-of-survey-test-fishing-nors/, description of API https://dvfisk.slu.se/swagger/index.html

Other NorsAggregerad API functions: nors_aggregerad_huvudavrinningsomraden(), nors_aggregerad_lan()

Examples

# This example will access the Internet to get the data and will not work offline
# Get all data from the main drainage area 24000 (Rickleån).
data <- nors_aggregerad_rapport(HaroNr = 24000)
head(data)
